meanings.definition: A type of airship that can be steered and controlled.
meanings.sent1: The dirigibles floated gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The dirigibles were used for transportation in the early 1900s.
meanings.sent3: The dirigibles looked like giant floating balloons!
meanings.sent4: The dirigibles painted the sky with their majestic presence.
meanings.sent5: The dirigibles hummed softly as they glided through the clouds.

meanings.definition: Able to be directed or guided.
meanings.sent1: The dirigibles path was easily adjustable.
meanings.sent2: She had a dirigibles mind, always open to new ideas.
meanings.sent3: His dirigibles decisions often led to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent4: The dirigibles nature of the project allowed for flexibility.
meanings.sent5: The dirigibles course of the river changed with the seasons.
